0$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/30/2019 10:57:43 AM$Reviewer: Anonymous
column2: 13-18 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$Very powerful for fixing attention problems. It makes it much easier to work
column3: however the side effects are strange and concerning. There is a significant loss of appetite and dry mouth
column4: but these are not terribly strange. While the medicine wears off (which takes hours)
column5: paranoia and confusion can set in. While these happen
column6: there is a feeling of freezing despite the actual temperature
column7: possibly due to a lack of food? Either way
column8: very good for what it is meant to do but unfortunate side effects.

column1: 1$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/18/2019 2:27:43 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$2$4$Horrible
2$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/31/2019 11:57:05 PM$Reviewer: Willsmommy09
column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$My 9yr old was having so so much trouble in school and having bad anger issues
column3: his pediatrician put him on 18ml methylphenidate and I've seen such a huge difference
column4: since the 1st day he took it his teacher messaged me to tell me the progress he had!! I'm hoping it continues to work
column5: hes only complained of slight dizziness and some nausea but other than that he says he feels fine:) I'm only upset I didn't take him to the dr sooner!

column1: 3$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/14/2019 9:03:08 AM$Reviewer: Kmennis
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I am an adult with ADHD since childhood. My psychiatrist and I tried several medications including Adderall which gave me mild anxiety. I take Vyvanse during the day and methylphenidate in evenings when I have school work. The methylphenidate helps keep me focused with no side effects. Only issue is that it only lasts a couple hours. Most ADHD medications do not last as long as they are supposed to. Vyvanse is a 12 hr med and I am doing good if I get eight hrs with it. Would prefer to take Vyvanse twice a day
column3: but insurance would never pay for that
column4: so methylphenidate is a great option.

column1: 4$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2019 10:07:04 AM$Reviewer: Happy to be me now
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I have severe ADHD and this medicine makes me feel more normal than with out it. I also have depression and it helps that as well.... I actuallt dont jave any sode effects either. Hope it continues to help me.

column1: 5$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/14/2018 10:19:46 AM$Reviewer: Methylphenidate er
column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$5$4$I have taken Adderall or Concerta for most of my life and all of my adult life
column3: ironically I'm currently hospitalized with a stage 4 wound located directly above my anus
column4: During this hospitalization they lowered my Concerta from 54mg down to 27mg and upon my insistence and a request it has been increase to 36mg. I feel that 54mg would be a much more effective treatment.

column1: 8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/20/2016 11:47:18 AM$Reviewer: Ethan
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$4$This med does help me to concentrate on tasks better than I was able to prior to taking it. The side effects are not too bad. I do notice that I tend to yawn quite a bit when I'm taking it
column3: but oddly
column4: I'm not tired. It also gives me sweaty palms. Otherwise
column5: I feel it is working well.

column1: 9$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/7/2016 3:17:41 PM$Reviewer: Leah
column2: 13-18 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$3$Every time I took this medicine I had a rapid heart beat
column3: excess sweating
column4: agitation
column5: mood swings
column6: decreased appetite. And occasionally muscle  twitching
column8: numbness in my fingers and toes which made it hard for me to write/ type. I always took prescribed amount. The medicine did not help much with my condition but gave me all these side effects inside. Would not recommend.

column1: 10$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/17/2016 6:05:48 PM$Reviewer: Tyler Weitzel
column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I didn't like the long acting pills
column3: so I don't recommend taking anything other than plain ritalin tablets.  I've heard that you can build up a tolerance to the medication; however
column4: I never felt like that happened to me over the 5 years I took it.  I was prescribed 60 mg a day
column5: which was the best
column6: but usually found that I could take less by breaking the pill in half.  I felt like it was too much sometimes
column7: and it was time to take a pill
column8: so I'd break it in half and save the remainder for another day.  It had always helped me achieve better grades without feeling like i had to try.  I watched other students struggle and I felt like the drug in a way kind of cheated out better grades.  I definitely recommend the plain methylphenidate tablets.  It seemed like the long acting capsules were not manageable.  We can't take less than the prescription and the three hour tablets allow this.

column1: 11$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/14/2016 6:10:18 PM$Reviewer: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$5$My daughter is 7 years old and was taking this medication for two days when I had to rush her to the Emergency room because her heart started rapidly beating and she was having conscious blackouts. It was a very scary situation.

I dont have to worry about forgetting to take pills or anything which is nice. It also doesnt effect my diet as much as other meds.

column1: 13$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/28/2014 1:11:48 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $2$2$2$"This generic form (oval tan color) doesn't work very well for my ADHD compared to other generic forms. I have been taking ""Concerta"" for 11 years. "

14$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/1/2014 8:41:36 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$"I started taking ADHD meds in 2009. I started with Vyvanse.  I had terrible side-effects: constipation
column2: inability to urinate (I would have an extreme desire to pee like if I didn't immediately go to the bathroom I was going to pee my pants. Then
column3: I would stand there for 20 to 30 seconds before beginning an it would be a squirt
column4: then another 10 sec's with another squirt and when I couldn't go anymore it felt like I hadn't emptied my bladder.) I would get terrible acid-indigestion
column5: my back would hurt
column6: headaches
column7: and the worse of all the side-effects was the numbness in my hands and feet. The numbness at night got to a point that my fingers felt like they were on fire(literally burning).  I actually had to wear wrist bands
column8: like people who have carpel tunnel syndrome
column9: and that would alleviate the burning enuf to go to sleep.

column1: The doctor changed my medication to Adderall and I had identical side-effects; no worse
column2: but no less. He suggested that I continue the medication and eventually the side effects will dissipate.  I took the Adderall for a year and 1/2 and the side effects never lessened.(by the way
column3: I'm not a masochist). I just enjoyed the psychological benefits so much that I continued to soldier-on with the terrible side effects so I could have focus
column4: have conversations
column5: organize my thoughts
column6: have less depression

column1: The misery finally won over and I quit taking the medication.  Nearly a year later I was so upset that I couldn't have the good without the bad. I nearly begged my doctor for something else that could help.  This is 2014 and I first started ADHD medication in 2009 with horrible results.  It took me badgering my doctor to get him to give me Ritalin.  His first response was: ""Ritalin is for children"" but he finally gave me a prescription and all I can say is WOW! All the ADHD problems addressed and no side-effects.  It's only been 2 months on Ritalin but when I took the other drugs I experienced the side-effects within 2 days."
15$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/15/2014 1:51:28 AM$Reviewer: ecstaticmom
column2: 3-6 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $5$4$4$My son has been taking this for 4 months
column3: starting just after he turned 6. He has done a total 180. He went from almost being expelled in kindergarten to a star student. His handwriting is now legible and he can sit and read me a book with no problem. I went from not wanting to medicate my child to grateful that I did. It didn't make him a zombie and he still has plenty of personality. This drug won't work for everyone
column4: and can have some horrible effects on some people. All ADHD drugs are trial and error. He does metabolize it faster than he should so we only get about 10 hours out of a 12 hour dose but on the plus side of that
column5: he sleeps fine. He did stop asking to eat throughout the day
column6: and lost weight as a result but his Dr talked to HIM about eating and eating high protein foods so he wouldn't lose anymore. A month later
column7: he had gained all but 2 oz of it back. We still have to remind him to eat but he will if he's asked to. I've known since he was 2 that he had ADHD and I'm glad that I finally decided to address medicating him. He's now the delightful little boy I knew was always in him somewhere. My family and friends have noticed the huge change and now ask him to have sleepovers and playdates
column8: which almost never happened before Concerta. He'll start going to Boys & Girls Club in the fall after school and he's super excited
column9: which would have never been possible without this medication.

column1: 16$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/5/2014 2:36:01 PM$Reviewer: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$

19$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/17/2014 1:22:35 PM$Reviewer: Pancurium
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$5$5$Drugs impact is more far reaching than adhd symptoms. Virtually eliminated insomnia
column3: impacted cholesterol numbers and stabilizd my blood pressure at great levels. After a lifetime of adhd coping mechanisms in place along with this relatively mild drug has worked wonders for me. In the years since restarting this drug as an adult I have made incredible professional and personal progress. I think too much unrealistic expectations are placed on this drug but it is not a magic pill. It works great for me used in conjunction with coping habits I have developed throughout my life.

column1: 20$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/8/2014 8:11:35 PM$Reviewer: Jonothon
column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$5$"I have taken this drug before and for me it did not work very well
column3: i do not have ADHD that bad and honestly people don't know unless I tell them my biggest problem is I am easily distracted. When i took this drug the first month everything was going good my penmanship improved greatly along with vocabulary but about 2 months in I was very irritable and I just feld so much anger and hatred towards everyone. By the 3rd    month my mother had me seeing a psychologist because I beat my brother up pretty badly and was extremely aggressive
column4: we later found out it was not me it was the medication. This drug can work but talk to your doctor if you notice some of the side affects listed on this site and I wouldn't pay attention to the ""Sever""
column5: ""Less Severe"" part because it may affect you differently than it has others in the past."

column3: behavior
column4: and schoolwork and all for the good! However

29$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/31/2012 5:22:05 PM$Reviewer: lilred
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I love this med. I could feel the wheels turning in my head and immediately after taking my first Ritalin it stopped. I can stay focused
column3: get things done instead of being all over the place. My conversations I would keep repeating myself. My friends are amazed at the difference it has made since I started taking it. The Psych wanted me on the 40er but I dint like them at all. I take 10mg in am and 10mg at noon. Perfect dose for me. I think sometimes doctors want to give you a stronger dosage then you need. Kids on the 40mg seems to me like an awful lot. My BP is lower my pulse has slowed down
column4: I can sleep better at night. It works great for me.

35$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/29/2012 6:41:13 PM$Reviewer: TheEradicator, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$5$I am 17 years old and I have been taking this for about 3 months. I started on 54mg and it wasn't enough so then I moved up to 72mg. That was way too much for me and I started freaking out. My heart was racing, I was running around in circles trying to get my energy out and it just hurt really bad. So then I took 63mg, and I have been fine on it, although I feel that it could help me focus more. But the worst thing about it is it makes me depressed. I was already sorta depressed before but when I take this, it makes it so much worse. 
36$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/13/2012 4:46:05 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$3$5$First I was perscribed the 10mg dose. It was too much for me and I felt a come down when it wore off 3-5 hours later. Told my doctor about it and he perscribed 5mg. I was able to focus on tasks much better on either dose but I don't feel a come down from the 5mg pill. However, after taking this med once or twice a day for 3 or 4 days I had become easily agitated and somewhat agressive and I'm a pretty mellow guy. I only take it now if I have a task that requires my attention for long periods of time because I do have a problem staying focused but I'm not hyperactive and never have been.
37$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/29/2012 10:15:34 AM$Reviewer: Relieved mom, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $3$5$3$My son is 8 years old in the 2nd grade. The last 3 years I have gotten feedback from the teachers indicating minor behavioral problems with him such as, he has a hard time focusing, he cant sit still, he speaks very loud, and now in 2nd grade, his comprehension in reading was starting to reflect a problem. I never realized this at home because at home he read and comprehended his books just fine, however, these were books of his preference. I took him to the doctor who recommended this medication. Although it has only been a week, I have notice a change with focus and patience. I watched my son who never sat still, draw detailed pictures for an hour(He has never sat more than 10 min on anything other than video games). As far as school goes, he has been paying more attention in class and finishing his homework independently. My only complaint is that when this medication wears off, it really wears off and it seems like all of the controlled hyper was bottled throughout the day, then released at once but only lasts for a little while and doesn't interfere with bedtime. Overall this medication has helped and I now see a side of my child that I have never seen before and I am really pleased.
38$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/18/2011 1:33:57 PM$Reviewer: **CAT**, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am 50 years old have have been recently diagnosed with ADD....what a new feeling i have. Now i know what was wrong with me my whole life. I am so excited to claim rights to a new me!!
39$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/2/2011 12:05:21 PM$Reviewer: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $2$2$5$blurred vision within three hours after use
40$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/14/2011 2:49:15 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was in 4th grade and I have explored taking other meds and which one worked best for me. I started taking it in 5th grade and I'm now in my first year of college. Concerta has helped me to actually do homework instead of getting bored 5 minutes into homework and class. I have become an actual student and avid learner thanks to concerta. I think the new generic has made me break out because I used to have great skin but I can fix that. I would get used to the medication or I would realize it was too low of a dosage so my dosage is up to 54. Although through out the years the one bad side effect is that I would have upset stomach or weight loss but I was fine with that but the extreme side effect that I still fight when I don't take my medication is my overwhelming and complete ravenous hunger I get. I will literally eat everything in sight. So I feel a necessity to take my concerta everyday. But besides that I would recommend this to anyone wanting an ADHD medication.  
41$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/11/2011 7:09:47 PM$Reviewer: Screen Name, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$3$2$I've been taking this medication on and off as needed since last November. What I can say is it has had several pro's along with some con's. Here is a list of Pro's and Con's of Generic Ritalin IR that I've experienced.
Pros:
- Better Concentration (my ability to focus has moved to having 25% focus to 60% focus)
- Helps me be more awake and focused in class at school.
- Grades have slightly improved in school.
- Doesn't last too long so I can take it around 6pm and still be in bed no later than 1am.
- It's Cheap
Cons:
- I sometimes crash and get really tired when the effects wear off.
- I sometimes have an empty feeling while on it
column2: it's similar to depression but not a bad (it still sucks though)

column1: - Hard to take since it doesn't last long
column2: sometimes it lasts 2 hours other times 4-6.

column1: - I feel bored on it when doing things I normally enjoy.

42$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/15/2011 10:42:14 AM$Reviewer: Dad concerned, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$4$We changed from the medication Concerta to this generic version due to insurance reasons. Apparently concerta is no longer covered due to this cheaper pill. My 10 year old has been making strides since going from adderall (too much weight loss) straterra (ineffective) to concerta (working the best so far). Now with this new generic, he has a daily scowl on his face, simple arguments turn to serious tantrums and none of these things were present when on concerta. If this is just a generic version then why such serious side effects that the other didn't have. School is starting soon and playing with medications for my son is completely unacceptable. I will be meeting with my doctor to correct this week, but the fact that insurance can just change on a dime is pretty ridiculous. 
43$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/11/2011 7:38:33 PM$Reviewer: hudson615, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$5$4$I love this drug. 44$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/28/2011 8:17:51 AM$Reviewer: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $3$1$3$I am writing on behalf of my step-son, who when he took this, almost killed his sister.(he was choking her, and thought this was just fine)  this is NOT in his nature, but when on this, he had these awful violent urges. Just watch your children carefully for mood changes if on it, it doesn't do the same for all, good or bad. He has changed to another, and is doing excellent in school, his behavior is much better, and he doesn't have scary thoughts like that.

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$1$I have been taking Concerta since i was 6.  I have increased the dosage a bit over the years
column3: but as my life got more complicated the medicine became more of an issue. I am a serious athlete and have struggle with balancing this medicine
column4: training
column5: school
column6: and my health. I find that there are several very serious problems  with this medicine.  Concerta dramatically decreases appetite to the point were i had to force-feed myself because my body was hypoglycemic and i felt faint after hard workouts. While the medz realyl helped at school
column7: it is not long enough lasting so that i can effectively do homework at 9pm
column8: but if i was to take a larger dose
column9: i would never sleep.  some other side effects that have really hurt me are abdominal cramping
column10: dramatically increased sweating and intense nausea
column11: all of which are serious issues when you are a cyclist and training/racing in 90*F.  This medicine is fine if you arent an athlete
column13: you will find that its is helpful only if you can master/ work around its (potentially) serious side effects.  For me
column14: this has been a deciding factor in my life
column15: even though as of now im still a teenager. i hope that this review has been helpful
column16: and that more reviews like this may motivate the company Concerta to develop a more athlete friendly medication

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I am currently on 40 MG of the sustained release a day
column3: as well as a 10 MG short acting dose to be used when needed. i have found that the drug is very affective at allowing me to focus. i have a slight mood change but nothing drastic; i occasionally become monotone

column6: and the fact that im lazy

column9: that seem to be normal are that when im on the drug i lose my hunger and dont usually eat lunch
column10: as soon as it wears off though
column11: i am immediately hungry. also if i take my pill too late i cant sleep until it has worn off. this effect only happens when i take my pill within approx. 4-5 hours of when i want to sleep. also when it wears off i become extremely tired and can usually nap for 3< hours. other than these side effects which are not drastic
column12: i would highly recommend the drug.

column1: 74$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/5/2009 3:05:13 AM$Reviewer: Grateful
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking methylphenidate for 3 months now. I presently take the immediate acting pills at 180 mg/day
column3: i.e.
column4: 40mg tid. I took Concerta 36mg/day for 3 years and it stopped working well so I was changed to Adderall
column5: then to Dextroamphetamine. The Dextroamphetamine worked well
column6: but it made my skin break out badly. If we can get the dose of Methylphenidate optimized I will stay with it. I am studying for the GRE so that I can go to graduate school. The medicine helps me to stay on task and keeps my mind from wandering. My ADHD manifests mostly as the inattentive type with comorbid depression
column7: anxiety disorder and slight shizoaffective disorder. It has taken many years
column9: and many trials of different medications to get the correct mix and dosages. Thank God I am stable enough to go back to school and almost get the education that I had originally attempted. I  attended 3 years of medical school before I had to withdraw due to symptoms of my then undiagnosed ADHD. I am now 54 years old and until fairly recently have missed a diagnosis of ADHD all these years. It is only extremely evident that I have ADHD when I take the medications for it. I go from a good student to my normal excellent student status. The attendant symptoms of ADHD have crippled my chances for the lifestyle I had planned
column10: but I can't gripe much because the pain they caused me drove me into the loving arms of my dear Lord and Savior and I am now one of His ordained and grateful ministers
column11: a path I would not have taken without the pain from ADHD.
